message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.SI

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Speech and Dialogue Processing (cs.SD) as it focuses on improving distant speech recognition. It also involves the use of neural networks, which could place it in the sub-categories of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). The recursive architecture used in BridgeNet could also suggest a potential fit for the sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY). Finally, the use of intermediate feature representations from a teacher network could place it in the sub-category of Signal Processing (cs.SI).
